Summary: Checked in for 2 night stay, to enjoy a couple of days at knots berry farm and the room was infested with roaches. They moved us when I complain to another room. And to our disappointment that room was also infested. Discussing. Stay away!

Unfortunately, this hotel is not one we will return to: extremely rundown and not sure which rooms are portrayed on the website are. We rented a total of three rooms and all of them were rundown: 1) cigarette burns and holes on ALL THREE rooms' bedspreads. 2) We had to move from one room due to the horrible mold smell. 3) They installed wooden blinds on the windows, which is a very nice touch but did not bother taking off old railing. 4) suspicious stains all over the rooms' couch, carpets and blankets 5) Tiny towels  6) broken air conditioning units that they tried to patch up with double sided tape instead or repairing. 7) Super noisy air conditioning and hotel in general 8) The pillows felt like lumps of coal and the mattress looked like it had not been replaced in years.
Room tip: I unfortunately will not say that there were any good or even decent rooms.

Summary: I like the room and privacy. I like the services and location of my room. I want come back again i like the place. And price. I told my friend for come to visit the place.  Thank you so much. And have a good beautiful day.

The room appeared clean upon arrival, but that was because of the maid. The carpets were so filthy that if you walked barefoot on them before taking a shower you'd see black marks in the tub. The doors were barely able to close. There were some benefits though,  flat screen TVs, microwave, refrigerator and window shutters.

Itâ€™s right next to knotts (10 min if you walk slowish), the staff is super friendly and helpful (they go out of their way to put the customer first), the hotel is super clean, beds are comfortable, the WiFi and cable tv works. When you walk across the room in socks, they stay white!!!!! This is where we will be coming back to. Great job guys, thanks so much. Most importantly, unlike neighboring hotels, Knights Inn does Not offer 8% off off your total bill for positive reviews!

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY AT THIS DIRTY PLACE
Summary: The place is disgusting... dirty dirty dirty and smelly smelly smelly.  i called them about the air conditioner that was not working and they came up and said that it will take time...... yet when it did come on it sprayed out debris that looked like mold all over the floor and bed. and i took pics of this. it was filthy.  that probably explains the horrible smell in the room.. just a filthy place

DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I stayed for a night and 3 days later there were several unauthorized charges on my card for several hundred dollars. I tried to make a complaint to the hotel and their corporate office Wyndam, and both places said we dont want to hear your complaint---take it up with your credit card company and the police and hung up on me

A few minutes walk to Knotts, ten minute walk to Wal-Mart and twenty minutes drive to Huntington beach. Good price, ok breakfast and a small swimming pool.  Its another motel and its very basic but its ok for what you pay.

The hotel itself is situated nice and close to Knott's Berry Farm, 2 blocks to walk. We were here for 9 days, made it our base for all our travels around southern California. The Hotel is clean and the a/c works really well, keeps the room almost to cold. It has a pool which is nice on those hot days, only thing with that I had to clean it myself from all the leaves in it. The beds were a little hard to my liking but comfortable enough to get a good nights sleep. It has a fridge and microwave to help save some on eating out all the time. The front desk guy was very nice and helpful. Overall, I would probably stay here again.
Room tip: Our room was on the north side where there is an empty lot

Summary Heading: Our first visit to California. Today this just happened RIGHT NOW!!! 07/12/17
Summary: After driving 12 hours from Texas to California. I booked this hotel a week prior to our visit. Will driving there we received a call from the general manager "Sam" he was rude right from the beginning!! However we were already tired and kept the reservation. My best friend and I decided to take our little boys with us. So finally we get to the room and the room smelled like pee and mildew (wet carpet or clothes). We started seeing nats everywhere. And then the room was not clean. The covers had burn holes in them, cut up . Walls had writing all over it, the smoke detector had a plastic bag over it!! Walls had holes all in it!! Nothing was wiped down. So we told the manager and he still didn't change the sheets. Then as we started leaving you see the cleaning lady take the clean

On Fri March 3 to March 5. 2017. Myself and my fiancee stayed at this hotel. Got in room noticed lights by bed did not work. Also light by table did not work.  Also noticed carpet was very dirty. Hole in wall and no ice bucket. Then are second night. After long day at knotts. I went to lay down in bed felt something sharp rub against my foot. Found out it was a piece of broken glass scratched my foot to where it hurt. I slept sitting up uncomfortably. Remind u asked for maid service earlier that day.  How can u say u cleaned room if we found this is our bed. Notified manager. He is saying we put in the bed. Oh yeah we wanna cut are feet. How dumb is that. No compensation. So this place is rating of 1. Very poor. Unhealthy

Safe and friendly, clean. It has a fridge and a microwave. It was hard to get just the right water temperature out of the sink and shower. We would have appreciated breakfast in the lobby. We had to ask for bath towels our second day because they didn't replace the ones they took. A thermostat would have been a nice touch; I had to turn the heat on and off manually.

It's a nice hotel parking is good the staff is really friendly and the rooms are nice. Was pretty quiet without much noise while we stayed there. With this in mind keep in mind it is a motel! The beds are not the comfiest in the world but for the value and the location and the overall quality of our stay it's the best motel I've ever stayed at. I wouldn't spend extra money going to a fancy hotel for a few days if every motel was the same quality as this one!

Place was a good little find.  the room did smell though.  and parking could be an issue at times.    The toilet got blocked and when i told the manager about it, they fixed the issue, but he told me how to use a toilet properly... i guess i have been doing it wrong the last 40 years...  he was a little rude to me, but when my wife was there, he was friendly to her...  the bins outside were changed everyday and the place itself was well maintained.    it was in a good location, near resturants, a good theme park, although we never went, and also some good retail shops.    out of the 5 hotlets that we stayed in while we were on holidays, this was the second worse, but only becuas the others were good.  would recommend to other familes becasue it is, overall and good little find

So as a young rollercoaster enthusiast I was here for Knotts, this place is just across the road pretty much from the water park and a block from the main theme park. Buena Park is very nice as an area and this place is easily walkable to all the sights, restaurants and mall etc. The rooms were clean, they let me leave my bag at 6am before I went to Knotts (and it was a large bag!), laundry is being your own powder but is good, people in the area seemed fine, I would say it's 3 stars, not flash, kind of dated in decor but clean and useable. The area is pricey so it's okay value considering. Would recommend for a bed/pop in and out kind of place.

Summary Heading: I didn't know that same location used to be Days Inn in Buena Park, California.
Summary: The experience of my hotel room (201) went not bad at all. I had Great Air Conditioning, Very-good Wi-Fi Internet Service, and its widescreen color TV. In fact, it also had its digital adapter, thanks to Time Warner Cable. To me, that place is not so very bad at all.

Upon arrival, just judging how the lobby/office area was less than desirable. I was already regretting my decision to be cheap. When the common area isn't clean and neat, that sets the precedence for how the rest of the place is going to be. The guy behind the counter was quiet, there wasn't a warm welcome, but whatever, we don't have to be friends! We get our keys and go to our room and it looks okay, what you would expect for a cheap stay in tourist area. However, there was this moldy/mildew-ish type black stuff on the bathroom wall and you could tell the bathtub wasn't properly cleaned as there was hair in it. It can be washed out, right? That night I couldn't sleep from this noise that was either the mini fridge or something inside the walls popping, very irritating. I got 2

Summary Heading: Looks can be deceiving - There profile pic does not say a thousand words
Summary: Im still trying to figure out why this DUMP is still open, Walking into the room to see filthy carpet was just the beginning so I thought. I removed the stained comforters and threw them on the floors to walk on. At least now the carpet look better. As I proceeded to the molded ceiling bathroom, it was time for me to turn around and exit this room. I don't know how Osha and the California Health Dept. lets this establishment stay open. In the good words of Siskel & Ebert.....2 THUMBS down.

Located in a quite back road of the main Buena Park highway, the Inn was quite comfortable.  It is an old place and needs to be upgraded.  The rooms were not flawless, if anything it was very worn, but we were not in the room for very long.  It was a place to relax during the evening after a full day of adventure.  Located in the middle of several attractions like Knotts Berry Farm, Soak City, Downtown Buena Park Mall, Wal-Mart, Neighborhood Wal-Mart, and Target.  Also enjoy some of the restaurants within the area.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and I'm glad you saw us as a great value.

Summary: We stayed 2 nights here. It is a 10 minute walk to Knott's Berry Farm (5 minutes to their parking lot). They had a room that had 3 queens beds so our family of 6 could stay in 1 room. Nothing fancy. Nothing bad either. Pretty uneventful stay. I would for sure stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and I'm glad you saw us as a great value.

Summary: We got a standard queen room, booked online. Check in was normal, the front desk attendant didn't really seem to care whether we were there or not. Nothing personal of course, not everyone loves their job.  Our room was clean(wish). I don't say super clean because you could tell it wasn't. I pulled the hair dryer off the wall and the whole piece ripped off.. I laugh only because luckily they didn't charge my card!  Otherwise, its close to a mall with a movie theatre and the Knot's Berry Farm activities.The pool was DIRTY, but in their defence California is going through some serious drought so they can't consistently clean out the pool. When they did clean it out, a guest actually came out of his room to tell them to stop because they were wasting water. The reply they gave, is

No dog this time, but a very accommodating staff. Not sure why this place is rated three star, but it might be for the thick towels, micro, fridge in the room. Plus, they recommend not buying the Knots Berry Farm parking pass and simply walking the ten minutes to get in. All in all, I would stay there again as there is plenty nearby to do and see.

Summary Heading: The price is good, but that is about it.
Summary: The area is nice, seems safe enough, which can be hard for low cost hotels in LA area. But that is about where the good stops. While there were no bugs in our room at least, the beds are uncomfortable, the shower had mildew and broken plumbing, the smell was musty, the electrical is DANGEROUS (ran form the lamps hanging on the wall behind the wall then plugged in to old outlets) and we had 3 outlets spark or quit working on us! I was afraid to use the microwave because the ground part of the plug had been cut off, and the refrigerator froze everything, both in and out of the freezer area. For a Wyndham property, I expected much better than what I got. When I asked for extra wash clothes for our room, they kept trying to give me towels, as if they had no idea what a wash cloth

This stay taught me the value in sticking to known chains, pictures can be very deceiving.  Half a step up from sleeping in the car.  I don't believe they vacuume. Found a huge tuft of hair on the floor by the trash can. Ad claimed they had a pool.  The pool was not working, they said the pump had gone out that morning.  There was a padlock on it and no card read - obviously not open in a long time.  Old, dirty and our room key didn't work.  After 4 trips to the front desk, they finally gave us the pass key to all of the rooms so that we could get our 4 and 5 year old grandsons into the room after all day and night at Knotts.  Use La Quinta or Holiday Inn, not worth the savings.

My husband and i had stayed before here on the second floor and it was a reasonale stay but the second time we got the first floor and the housekeeping was done poorly, the everyday we had to get the key reprogrammed. The bed gave my husband a rash all over his body. Not to mention we booked last minute and it was the month of conferences and we were charges $100 a night for the mediocre place but we had no further choice considering it was late. Will not stay here again.
Manager Response: thannkx for your review.we are really sorry for your  bad exprience while you stay here.if you let management know about your issue  we can take a steph to fixed your problem.If you come this area again please give us another opportunities to serve you.i think you will enjoy next time.  thank you.

Summary Heading: This world is just made up of COMPLAINERS!
Summary: This hotel is one of the greatest values for the money that I have seen.  I was nervous reading some of the reviews, but pulling up I didn't think the neighborhood was that bad and I was greeted warmly by the front desk clerk and quickly checked in.  Getting in the room it looked nice and clean and I didn't have any problems whatsoever.  Keep in mind that you get what you pay for.  What do you expect for $40 bucks.  I routinely spend more for hotels and almost did for this night. I'm used to staying in lots of larger big brand hotels, i.e. Hiltons/Hyatts.  I could have stayed there in Anaheim - for about three times the price plus parking fee.  No thanks.  People need  to stop complaining about every little thing.  I'm sure their homes aren't perfect either.  This was a clean
Manager Response: thank you for your review.we hope we will see you soon.....thank you.

Summary: This is a very reasonable place with responsible management! I must say, I totally feel safe here!, unlike other hotels I've stayed at. Compared to the previous management I totally feel that the present management is doing a super job at keeping the riff Raff out and the over all cleanliness is 100% better!

Well first and foremost, I want to be brutally honest....  Pulling up to the property, it looked tidy enough, the clerk at the front desk let me check in a couple of hours early so of course that made me happy and I asked for an upper level room because I LOATHE the sound of stomping above me!  So he gave me room #221, the very end room on the top facing the parking lot.  There is no elevator, which is okay....but as I headed to the staircase i was a little taken aback by the condition of the walkways and staircase!  It was filthy!  It could really use some power washing!  The room itself was small, dingy, dark, one double bed, everything super OLD!  I was a little mortified but I had to remind myself that I booked it for 3 days at $32/night on Priceline, which is quite a deal

This place was dark, creepy and EXTREMLEY DIRTY! We booked online and when we got there decided to look at the room before we got anything out of the car and glad we did. Holes in walls, DIRTY furniture with stains on furniture and carpet. Then pulled covers back on the bed and there were 3 bugs in the bed. We ask to cancel and get a refund. That was a BATTLE!! Oh outside lights weren't on and only one light in the room worked. JUST DONT STAY HERE!!!

Great location for this hotel it's right near knots berry farm within walking distance maybe about 3 blocks away, across the street is Farells ice cream restaurant (go early it gets packed) anything you need is close by. The rooms are decent for the price nothing fancy here old but clean room comes with microwave and mini frig good size bathroom cable TV also you get free coffee and donuts in front office. The swimming pool is in the very back of the property and is very private vending machines available and free ice I love the parking because you can park right in front of your room overall a great price and decent place to stay the owners are friendly :)

My husband and I have stayed at Knights Inn four times.  They have the best prices in the area.  The rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are comfortable.  The staff is top shelf.  I can't say enough good things about Tanvir, Harshell and Shaj.  Not just a great front desk but on a scale from one to ten, their customer service is a 12!  Tonya, the manager, is a consummate professional who works hard to make your stay enjoyable and stress-free.  The last time we checked in, Alejandro from maintenance, could see my husband had injured his knee and he insisted on carrying our luggage up to our room.  That's not his job but that's the kind of treatment you'll receive here.  We always feel like we're seeing old friends when we return, which I can guarantee we will again and

The good:  cheap hotel a quick drive from Disneyland, nice people at the front desk. The bad:  Enough was wrong with the room that I was convinced it wouldn't make a difference if I complained.  No cold water in the sink.  Missing dial on heater.  Dim light.  (New) bolt on door wouldn't lock or unlock unless I pushed my entire (155 lbs) weight against it.  My 11 year old wouldn't have been capable of escape by himself.    Fairly uncomfortable bed, but acceptable I guess.  We were in room 102.  The room was sweltering when we entered; I had to ask the front desk to come and change the heat because it was too difficult for me to do without the handle, especially with a little arthritis.  He took out a pair of pliers and adjusted the heat, like this was normal.  I guess they don't

Summary Heading: If given the option of this place or nothing...I'd choose nothing...
Summary: Although in a fairly good location close to Knott's, Disneyland and other things, I wouldn't ever stay here again.  Upon arriving, the woman at the front desk had an attitude about her. She just seemed to be very annoyed that she even had to be there.  Then there is the room...completely disgusting. The first thing I noticed was an obscene word carved into outside of the room's door. How wonderful. Then upon opening the door, the first thing you almost run into is the fridge and microwave. They're wedged in a space between the bed, window and door when there was clearly other space in the room to place them. Also the drapes were hanging down and touching all the coiling and electric elements of the fridge. That was just SCREAMING fire hazard to me. There is also no security lock

The location is good, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was very helpful, so its too bad the maintenance is so bad.  My toilet seat was broken, and so was the drain stopper in the bath tub.  There must have been a short in the dressing area light switch, because it came on when it wanted to, rather than when I hit the switch.  I am surprised that the management is not aware of these issues.

it was noisy, people running around banging on doors, stains on the sheets, hair in the bed and tub, black mold on the bathroom ceiling, ceiling falling in in the bathroom felt like the next floor was going to come in on me

You get what you pay for, nothing special but decent.  We did not know about the $99 deposit, it was very inconvenient especially since now 3 days later we still haven't gotten it back.  They over charged us for our room and it took a lot of run around to even get the money back.  We will not stay here again.

Don't stay at this hotel. It is a good price but very poorly maintained. The shower curtains, sheets and towels had stains and were torn. The room was murky and dirty and there was a horrible smell. The TV did not work at all. There was no parking available. I would not recommend this to anyone.

Unfortunately, the hotel Knights Inn didn't have the room I reserved in advance. Secondly, they asked for a security deposit of $100 plus, which I was never informed about. The employee at the time was rude explaining the hotel policies. The room itself had a terrible odor, stained bed sheets & left over food in the refrigerator from the previous person. Overall, the Kinghts Inn displayed poor hospitality.

Summary Heading: Good value for a good price.
Summary: The value and price was great. The location is perfect to go to Knott's, Disney & California Adventure. The room was not bad and was clean. My family felt comfortable and the beds were soft. Overall, I have been here twice and would come again and again.

Here for Knotts Scary Farm and to see Elvira. Place is within walking distance of the park, check in was quick, room is ok, little dated but everything works. Bathroom is clean, bed is comfy. looks like new carpet.

Summary Heading: I would not recommend this hotel
Summary: My room bathroom had 7+ hairs on the shower wall, front lock didn't work, desk clerk unfriendly.

Got a great deal on Priceline. Wanted a close stay to Knotts Berry Farm and you can't get closer than this. Able to park at the motel and walk across to Knotts.  Real basic and could use a remodel but had a quiet clean room with a working TV and a good hot shower with good water pressure. Very helpful front desk staff. This is where I'm staying for any future Buena Park amusement parks.

My husband and I stay here as often as we can the rooms are clean a bit dated but clean and safe nice pool in back and fresh coffee and donuts in the morning best priced hotel for the area very nice management
I stayed in room 114 - ground floor in the back. Huge bathroom, king bed. AC worked well (individual unit in room). Mattress is very saggy/soft as of 9/10/14.

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel, Good Location, was upset that we had to stay...
Summary: Decent Hotel, Good Location, was upset that we had to stay a few extra days, and the front desk lady in the mornings would not give us the 20% discount you receive online if you book more than 2 nights, but we ended up staying 5. She made us pay individual nights rates, which made me kinda annoyed. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE if you ask me, why not give us the same curiosity!! Other than that all the front desk people were very nice and helpful, can't say enough nice things about them. Maybe someone could do something about the bad taste her service left in our mouths???
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review for our property.  Unfortunately we couldn't match the discount offer online because you were paying daily, and not the 2 nights together in advance.  Online reservations specifically says: make reservations for 2 days and save 20%.  We also have to mention that as a courtesy we waited for you to have the funds in your account to make the payment for the 1 night when you decided to extend, even-tho stay overs must pay by 11 am. Next day when you decided to extend again, we granted you 10% discount as we do with customers that make reservations directly with us. I think we treated you fairly, as our job as a Wyndham property is give out guest rate parity.  We really apologized for the way we made you feel, but we have to follow our policies in order to be fair with all the guests.

Summary: Wow they are working on revamping this location and it shows. Front desk was on it since we did an online reservation with our rewards log in. Quick and easy got a super room, clean, fresh and was perfect. Frig and Microwave included. Ice machine close as was parking our car. Quite good night sleep and fast check out zero issues. Priced right too. Going to be coming back. New Flat screen TV also no going back to last century.

The first time we stayed here was fine no issues. The second time we were told we needed a deposit. The first time no deposit was ever mentioned.    The room is a typical room, but be prepared, you will be lucky if you find parking there after 8pm.
I was happy even though it was on the cheaper side for the area it was nice and clean and bigger than expected

Summary Heading: Nice but needs to work on the rooms and the staff attittude
Summary: Nice room but smelled funny, the bathtub was blocked and the bathroom door didn't close. Most of the staff is very nice but there was one particular woman (not the manager) who was extremely rude and with horrible attittude. There are better places around.

Staying in this flea bag motel ruined our trip. This place is dirty and gross. The deadbolt on the door did not work. The window lock did not work. Neither did the smoke alarm or hair dryer. This place is extremely dirty and ran down. We paid $100 per night and what a waste of money. I realize $100 is a cheaper rate compared to the other places in the area but it is still $100 of my hard earned money that I gave thinking i was getting a decent room. Wrong! The foreigners that run this place think its funny. They sit back and advertise a crappy place and take people's money under false pretenses. Go back to your own country.
I was the only adult with 5 kids so I needed 1 room with 3 beds. This was the only place I found that was available. The room was spacious & clean enough except the carpets were FILTHY.

Checked into first room, toilet seat was not fast to toilet. Checked into another room, toilet seat was loose. Tightened it myself in less than a minute. Wireless Internet was only working intermittently. Room smelled badly. Housing on air conditioner was crcked and broken. First room key cards given did not work. This hotel is hurting the Wyndham brand name.
The hotel rooms were very clean, housekeeping was thorough, front office staff was nice & hotel quiet.

Could have been cleaner. I am a property manager so I notice more things than the average person. Towels old and dingy. They were clean but still had a smell to them.  At check in only had 1 towel and a dirty one hanging on the back of the door. No wash cloths at check in. Caulking in bathroom could be replaced due to mold or mildew. Carpets very dirty. When we asked for towels we got them right away. AC made a buzzing noise when it was on. I am not a picky person. The hotel served it's purpose. I have stayed here before and will probably again if price is right. I will just bring my own towels and slippers

The staff was friendly and professional.   Everything was very clean and the maids just exceptional.  They should be given a bonus.  I mean it.  We often stay at more expensive hotels but it being 4th of July most were booked or just too ridiculous in the rate increase for the holiday.  We very pleasently surprised to find it so spacious and so clean.  It was a nice place to stay.  We would definitely stay there again when in that area.

First night was eventful with the motel laundry flooding and effecting our room. They were quick to get us into a different room even though it was 4 of July weekend. Great pool  would stay there again

Customer service would not be acceptable in a 3rd world country. Rude attendants. Broken pipe led to cold showers. When I asked if it would be fixed, I was lied to. Eventually left early to find somewhere acceptable. I can honestly say that I will definitely never ever be staying in this hotel, and possibly in this hotel group ever again.

Summary Heading: Stayed here due to the proximity to Knotts. Not to pleased...
Summary: Stayed here due to the proximity to Knotts. Not to pleased with the room we stayed in.  The air conditioning didn't work in one room and it was very stuffy.  The curtains in one room was torn and the Window screen had a hole letting flies into the room. We will not be staying here again. To bad because it was the perfect size for this family of 6 it offered 3 Queen beds.
Rate was reasonable and staff was friendly. Room was terrible with a droopy ceiling and funky smell.

I knew I shouldn't have expected much with the price that I was going to be paying, but I think the place could have been a little more taken care of. First off, the $100.00 deposit was a shock when I walked in to check in. By leaving that, it sort of had me in a financial bind. I could see if it was a nice room, but it wasn't. The bed was broken. I couldn't get a full nights sleep because my boyfriend and I kept sinking into the middle. The night we checked in, I went into a restroom to take a shower and found multiple strands of hair in the shower, that obviously were NOT mine. There was a spider that I found crawling off the towel. The only reason I didn't go back to the front desk to complain was because we were both so tired and didn't feel like moving all of our bags into

Summary Heading: Right price for last minute booking!
Summary: Booking one week before the event and was looking for a inexpensive property close to Knot'ts Berry Farm... was within walking distance to the Park ! Room was clean but too much room freshener, had to leave the window open for a while to air it out.  aged furniture needs repairs, but all in all.. great rate for a one night stay!
The customer service needs some work, the rooms need some remodeling and updating (TV), and be more clean and smell good. In the outside, the appearance of the Hotel could use some painting at least.

Summary Heading: not so nice a place to stay
Summary: sorry but besides the nice staff I cant say ANYTHING good about this stay. The first room I was given was filthy with urine in the bathroom,and more, the second room was almost as bad with cup rings and crumbs on the end table. the air only worked intermittently with no knob to adjust it, And to top it all off there wasn't anywhere to park my care because of the many people double parked including your management. and so I had to park on the street and walk to my room. not a good neighborhood and a very busy street. this was the worst stay ive ever had.

We decided to stay the night at this hotel because it was so close to Knott's Berry Farm, Medieval Times, Pirate's Dinner Adventure etc. The hotel room was large, clean, and in such a great location. The staff was helpful. The prices for the hotel room were fantastic considering it's location. Also, right up the road was a Starbucks so I was content! I would stay again because of the great price and location of the hotel.

Unpleasant even for the cheap price.   Pros: Cheap, free parking, pretty safe area.  Mini microwave and fridge in the room!  Cons: our non smoking room still smelled like smoke including mattresses  Extremely dated. I'm not even talking about nice decor - rusted, poorly maintained.   TV is tube based. you can get small cheap LCD displays for like $100 apiece come on!  Many people checking in here look like they mostly live under a tree but saved up $40 to treat themselves to a motel  Noise from the street if you have open windows or closed with cars - single paned horrid windows.   It looks as if this Hotel is frozen in the 80s at best. By that I mean, in 1985 someone made a decision to not even spend $5 to replace a rusted malfunctioning sink stopper.   If you're totally broke

I had to stay here for one night and that was too long.  The room was considered non-smoking but smelled like smoke.  The carpet was dirty.  The shower head was placed so low that I had to bend down to shower.  They don't provide soap so I couldn't wash my hands at the sink.  The deposit is also $100 for a $50 room.  How does that make sense?  Plus the hold on your credit card stays for 3-5 business days.  The only positive was the bed was comfy.

Summary Heading: decent hotel for the price we've paid... room has microwave...
Summary: decent hotel for the price we've paid... room has microwave and fridge... helpful when you have kids with you... no coffee maker in room but lobby is open 24 hours and they have hot coffee there. dingy carpet but it's not like we'll be sleeping there... close to knotts berry farm and restaurants... will stay here again no problem...

This location has received a few bad ratings. I couldn't disagree more. The room was clean, quiet, had no bugs, great water pressure, plenty of towels, and new sheets. The TV was older but not ancient. The staff were very kind and helpful. They were always smiling and ensuring that we had everything we needed. We needed directions to things and they always took the time to show us how to get where we were going. The gentleman at the counter even went as far as drawing me a map because the directions he was giving me involved many turns. The Location is a 5 minute walk to Knotts Berry Farm. I will definitely stay here again when I am in town

Summary Heading: Icky Hotel, Not Big on Safety or Comfort
Summary: The hotel's website seemed okay, the pictures were nice and it claimed to have a pool. Upon arriving from LAX on May 7, 2014 though I was sadly disappointed. The trouble first started with the front desk, who rudely insisted I had not paid up yet (although I had proof in my hands that I had pre-paid for my flight, hotel and rental car thanks to Southwest Vacations). They demanded my credit card, so I was forced to pay an additional $200 (it was later refunded after the manager found that I DID in fact pay, which the front desk agent refused to look for at first). Then we got to the room. It was dark, dingy, and the lock didn't even work. We had to sleep with a chair wedged up against the door, and even that was not enough to make us feel safe. Random room keys were left on our

Summary Heading: Clean, helpful staff, big rooms....everything to DONT expect from a Motel!
Summary: We stayed in The Knights Inn when family and friends went to nearby Knotts Berry farm. It was a surprise (a good one!) the rooms were quite, large, clean and well stocked for a Motel. The staff were helpful and the facilites were good (washing matchine, dryer etc) Location for us was fab - right across from Knotts berry farm. Price was good - overall excellent choice !
Not great. Not awful. A little concerned that the room I was in had broken locks (chain broken off, no deadbolt).

This hotel is right across the street from Knott's Berry Farm.  Prices are reasonable, rooms are clean, access is easy.  Great deal!  You don't hear any traffic.  You don't hear anyone in the next room to yours either.  I'd stay here again.

Summary Heading: This motel was good for the price. The parking was terrible...
Summary: This motel was good for the price. The parking was terrible and the shower didn't have the right curtain so water got every where when we showered.  The towels were like sand paper.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for Disney trip
Summary: Stayed here for two nights for a disneyland trip in a 2 queen bedroom. Room was clean with a TV, microwave and mini fridge. However, the room was a little cramped around the table/fridge area for 3 people. There was also no clock that's usually provided on the nightstand but we didn't mind. I was woken up one of the nights at almost 3am to the sound of some serious yelling and arguing between what sounded like drunk men and noisy speeding cars (there is a hookah lounge across the street.) That would probably be my only complaint of our stay here. Other than that, the drive to disneyland is not bad at all and it's worth the stay if you are not high maintenance and on a budget.

The room was extremely dated and in bad need of an upgrade and not exactly the cleanest. The price is one of the cheapest in the area so I guess you get what you pay for? Not recommended for anyone other than a single male traveler that just needs a cheap place to sleep.
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for your unpleasant experience as a guest of our property.  I appreciate the time that you took to bring this matter to our attention. I assure you that the matter will be looked into.  I also want to assure you that this is a very safe place for anybody to stay in, we never have had a problem, we are conveniently located close to the Parks so we are always patrol by Buena Park police and private Security; this is a part to keep all tourist safe. Once again, I apologize for your unpleasant stay and any inconvenience we may have cause you. Please allow us to Knights Inn the opportunity to serve you again in the future

Summary: The dead bolt toggle lock was broken.   The remaining lock could be opened with a flexable credit card.  Except for security, the room is what I exspected  except the that when I wanted to check out just before seven am the office was still closed - locked and a advertising magazine was taped to the night slot to cover the slot to return keys.    I slept well and had no other problems.   One gets what they pay for,  would I say again, if I'm alone, maybe.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback Rich, i am sorry your stay was nothing but perfect. I will address these issues with management so that on your next stay with us will be nothing but perfect.

Summary Heading: clean quiet close to Knotts and worth the price
Summary: We stayed in the family suite the Friday before Halloween.  Walking distance to Knotts Berry Farms.  Suite had 3 beds in two rooms separated by a wall not a door. Gave plenty of privacy. Clean linen and very comfortable beds.  Small fridge in the room.  Friday night was $120 plus $5 for parking. The charge for the parking was the only negative, but otherwise a nice stay. Staff was friendly.  No breakfast in the morning, but nice hot coffee.  We will be going back for sure.
Manager Response: The team at Knights Inn would like to thank you for taking time to tell us about your stay. We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed our convenient location, and our amenities. we value your feedback and have removed the parking fee. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Clean room, lots of space, micro and fridge (good value)
Summary: We stayed here for a little over a week in September. The room was clean, it wasn't cramped, it had a fridge, and a microwave. There were three of us (all adults), we found it to be comfortable. We did not spend much time in the room except for at night, its within 8 minutes of Disney, within 20 minutes of several beaches, almost right next to medieval times dinner... all in all we would stay here again. I did not care for their pool (its very tiny), but we never used it anyway in favor of the beach. Great value for someplace to sleep while enjoying a vacation in California.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your stay with us! We are happy you enjoyed your stay and that we exceeded your expectations. We are thrilled that you found the property to be so inviting. I will share your wonderful feedback with my staff including the housekeeping department. We look forward to having you as our guest on your return to Buena Park.

Summary: I certainly don't like to pick this hotel because every time we checked in at night for this hotel the night auditor/attendant is very rude and insanely not fit for hospitality industry. Priceline bidding end up to this disgusting hotel although its cheap, I would pay a little extra to be treated right. He was mad because there will be 2 adults and whatsoever so when my husband drop me off to go to the room and head out to walmart he stands in the middle of the street and wouldn't move as if he owns the freaking country. We have stayed here about 6x now and I can't go back there anymore. Im scared for that guy, very rude, creepy and suspicious. Plus internet sucks all the time and best of all there was a MOLD in our bathroom. We found out later on Sunday before checking out and
Manager Response: I would like to take this opportunity to apologize for your unpleasant experience as a guest at our Knights Inn. I assure you that the matter will be looked into. I want you to know that our hotel staff is trained in customer service and specially our night staff is also trained to keep the hotel safe and secure for every guest. It is his duty to walk out the property during night time. I am also surprised to see that if you feel so bad about our property you stayed 7 times, and I never seen that you had a complain before. Priceline is a bind site, so went you make a reservation with them it will give you the cheapest room available in the area you chose for the total of people you request.   Once again, I apologize for your unpleasant stay and any inconvenience we may cause to you.

Summary: Our room was disgustingly filthy....from the carpet to the mattress stains! The stench to the broken toilet seat.. the only great thing about this place is its location for Knotts! But...thankfully there are other hotels/motels that got it all right...well at least for my family!

We couldn't stay here due to black mold on the ceiling in the bathroom (same for two rooms).  My Mom couldn't shower here because the bathroom was so filthy.  We had dead bugs on our ceiling in our room and ended up paying the extra $40/night at Marriott.  A refund was provided for the room we didn't use here.
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology regarding your experience at our property. Your experience with Knights Inn was not the quality of service that we have promised to provide to our guest. I am truly sorry that we failed to provide you with our very best. I hope that you will give us the opportunity to serve you on your next visit to our area. If you decide to do so, please call our property directly, ask for me, and I will personally assist you. Respectfully, Tania Taylor

Summary Heading: return to the same motel we always stay at in buena park
Summary: We stayed here for 8 nights as we always do been staying here about 10 years now and the manager Tania is lovely she always makes us welcome and I find the room rate excellent for the area its in. Its very close to knots berry farm so you don't need to take your car you just walk across the road about 5 minutes walk it costs $15 to park your car so you are on a winner if you walk. Also very handy for all other entertainments in Buena Park I wouldn't stay anywhere else for the money you wont beat this place. The rooms are nice nothing flash but real comfortable and its quiet. I will definitely keep coming back to Knights in on Stanton you also get a free coffee service and continental breakfast although we don't have it as we love to have a fully cooked breakfast at dennys
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. It is always a pleasure to have you.  Looking forward to see you next year.

Summary Heading: The absolute worst experience of my life.
Summary: this hotel is probably the worst hotel I stayed at. first off you have to pay for parking there is not enough available spaces for your car then the front desk clerk will ask you to park on the road or empty lot behind the hotel.  They said they can't guarantee that your car will be safe. If your car gets damaged in the parking lot they will not pay for any damages. Refuses to accomadate guests. The clerk was rude and dissresptful. Don't ever go to this place

Summary Heading: BUGS and no refund. Do not use HOTWIRE!!!
Summary: Booked a room (RM#122) from Hotwire for 4/20/13. Bad mistake.  My wife and I got into our room late after spending the day at Disneyland and there were small bugs everywhere. On the beds, on the floor, and all over the bathroom. It was a no brainer, we left so fast. We could not take the bugs crawling on us and everything in there. Told the manager at the front desk and he didn't seem to care much and he also did not offer us a different room so we left to stay at a hotel down the street that we had stayed in the week before.   Tried to call Hotwire to receive a refund a couple days later after our vacation because the manager said he couldn't help me with that at the hotel because we booked through a 3rd party. Hotwire called the hotel and the hotel said that we had stayed in
Manager Response: Thank you for your review expressing the problems you encountered during your stay at the property. We sincerely apologize for the substandard condition of your room. At Knights Inn Buena Park, we take great pride in our high standards of cleanliness. Unfortunately, you experienced a time when we obviously did not meet those standards. We were very surprised that you mentioned that you found bugs in the room, as we recently remodeled the rooms, the carpets in all the property are brand new, not even a month old, and we conduct a periodically pest control in old our rooms.  We checked the room deeply and we did not find any kind of bugs at all. If you have taken any pictures at all, I would appreciate if you could send it to my email @  tania.taylor64@yahoo.com, we will review the case, contact Hotwire for a full refund of your stay. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know of this situation.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Nice place to stay
Summary: I travel a lot for a living, I stopped here for a week and I was very pleased by how clean the property was and how friendly the staff is. The room had excellent maid service. The wallpaper was in need of repair in the closet area and the TV could be updated.  The price was right for what we got. All I need is a place to sleep, charge my phone, and use internet.  The area was quiet and I would return again. Close to shopping, food and amusements.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review.  We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to having you as a guest in the future. Contact us directly to make your reservation so you can assure the best available rate. Regards.

Summary Heading: MY FAMILY TRIP TO KNOTTS BERRY FARM
Summary: It seemed like a good hotel when I saw the reviews on the internet, close to Knotts, but the first impresion when I got there, they first told me that my room was not available, so they upgraded us to a suite, there where  spiderwebs on the door, outside my room a full trash can, the door lock did not work, I had to put a table against the door, because someone tried to open the door 3 times at night, the room was not to clean, but I also recomend  that you take slipers to walk in your room and to go in to the tub. Tha bed was hard, sleeping on the floor would have been the same. There was a space underneath the door that a mouse could get in, and I mean a mouse, because there was a garbage container 20 feet from our room, the overall impresion, very bad, this property has not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your stay at our Knights Inn Buena Park.  First let me apologize for the inconvenience you experience as a guest of out hotel. Second I would like to address the concerns that you expressed. Our mattresses are all firm pillow top to provide with the best support, and we always receive compliments about them. We changed all our mattresses no more than a year ago.  All the rooms in the property have new carpets and padding, we made this change less than a month ago.  We have no mice or rats in the property as we conduct pest control service all the time.  We have outdoor corridors and so many trees around, and that may cause some spider webs here and there, buy we are very careful to power wash out outdoors twice a month so everything remains clean and pest free.  We have trash cans all over our corridors so it is easy for our guest to dispose their garbage, and that was never an issue in the property. Once again. I apologize for your unpleasant stay and any inconvenience we may have cause you. Regards

Summary: To start you get the enjoyment of paying an extra $5 fee per day for your car or it will get towed. Then you get to pay $6 hotel fee? Then in the room you get extra friends to stay with you in the bed on the carpet and the walls. Then when you ask for more towels or should i say rags they want to charge extra for them. It was close to the park but you get to see working girls getting extra cash in the parkinglot on the way to the park. Also we had to change rooms the first one had the door to the fridge and the plug came out and i mean the the socket with electrical burns.then and not leasr you have the drug dealers in the parking lot. O ps no breakfast and no coffee  makers in the room. I will never stay at a knights inn again.
Manager Response: We do not have any hidden fees, as our web page say, we charge a parking  fee, and the $5.00 fee is for the whole stay, and not daily. We do not charge any $6.00 hotel fee to anybody, if you were charged any other fee, please contact me at the hotel so it can be refunded.  The rooms as pretty clean and we do not any complaints of any kind of pest in the rooms, we have new carpets all over the hotel. We put a set of towels in the room, and if a guest needs extra towels we can offer them at the front desk, and we will never charge for them.  I really do not understand why is that you are posting something that is not accurate. The only extra charge that we have is a $5.00 parking fee, and it is detailed in our webpage.   We apologized for the problem you had with the refrigerator, and we tried to solve the problem and make your stay better changing you to a room with a working fridge.  This is a family friendly hotel, and we do not have drug dealers in our parking lot, not as we are aware of it.  Knights Inn standard do not offer breakfast or coffee makers in the room, and we do not offer that in our hotel description, we do have coffee 24 hours in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Sleeping Like Peasants at the Knights Inn
Summary: This is literally the WORST hotel experience I have ever had in my life.  We stayed here in September to stay after a trip to Knott's Berry Farm. There were many of us, and the employee told us over the phone that we were being given their "biggest room" which had two beds and a fold-out couch. This was a blatant lie.  We got to the hotel and there was no couch. As a result, two of us had to sleep on the floor.  The "complimentary breakfast" consists of a box of donuts that sit overnight in the lobby that the employees eat.  In the morning, when I went to take a shower, the water coming out of the shower was brown. I called the front desk and they said they would send someone over to fix it. I asked if I could use a neighboring shower, and was denied. When the employee came

The room was clean, clean sheets, clean bathroom. The bathroom could use a little updating. The bed was pretty decent to sleep on. We were on the bottom floor, so could hear people walking above us and could hear the shower water being turned on and off from the above room. The  tv, fridge, microwave all in good working order.We did have a little trouble with the door unlocking and not being able to lock it, but was able to fix it on our own. They could do a little better on the continental breakfast as they served bakery style doughnuts and coffee in the main office. Super close to Knott's Berry Farm, Medevial Times, and the Pirate dinner show. Our trip was actually to Disneyland which was only 7 miles down the freeeway. Super easy to get to and from from this hotel. We saved

Well, i was a bit iffy after seeing the reviews but my thinking was, this is a low budget unexpected trip and maybe the reviews were by picky travelers...Well, believe them ALL!   First I will explain the pros, the room is decent with a very firm bed. Clean sheets and our shower drained properly with plenty of hot, high pressure water. Nice working fridge w/ freezer and microwave. Tv got plenty of channels too.   Now the Cons, Very low signal on wifi, dirty carpet, hardly NO ONE was there, I saw so many empty rooms. Breakfast is not even worth going to the front desk for. I killed a very large wood spider the first night. Woke up the next morning to see a 2+ inch crawling thing on the wall and woke my husband to kill it. The next morning it rained and there were worms inside on

I had reservations to stay the weekend here and I didnt get to check in until after midnight since my travel was weather affected. The gentleman on duty was super nice and said everything was fine. The room we checked into had some major issues but it was fine to sleep in and the next morning we were switched into a different room. I was pleased that right off the bat we were offered a new room! Comfy beds made tbis stay awesome!

This hotel was in the center of so Cal and was across the street from knotts berry farm. The rooms were kept clean and they had a microwave and refrigerator in it. Front desk staff was also friendly and helpfull. We didn't use the pool but looked clean. I would reccomend this hotel to people who want to get some good rest but not pay and arm for a hotel.

Summary Heading: Stayed here while on vacation with family in July
Summary: This hotel is not for you if you enjoy luxury. It is dark and dingy, although they did have clean sheets and lots of clean towels. We only slept and showered here since we were out since the crack of dawn til very late at night. They did have donuts for breakfast in the office. They do have a pool. Great location near restaurants, Walmart, and a theme park. About 30 minutes to the beach with all the traffic lights. I would not recommend if you will be staying in your room all day, but if you are going to be out alot and dont mind budget hotels then I would.

Summary Heading: Worn down hotel good for cheap stay
Summary: The hotel is worn down and needs some serious maintenance to bring it to the level of appearance where I would feel comfortable suggesting that someone I know stay here in the future. The room was clean but because it was worn down it gave off a grungy appearance. There were broken park benches in front of the rooms and the soda machine was empty for the two days I stayed there. The room lacked basic amenities like an alarm clock and an iron. I did ask at the front desk for an iron and they went and bought me one. That was really nice but I ended up having to iron on the desk. The hotel says they offered free breakfast but placing a box of doughnuts on a counter does not qualify as offering a free breakfast. I was very disappointed by this. Overall, the room was cheap ($50) for

I had a great experience staying here and visiting Knox Berry Farm. Customer Service was awesome, I felt I was taken care during my stay. People complain about breakfast but I had no problem with that. I had breakfast all the days I stayed even after going late some days. Overall I think it is worth the price you pay.

Not a bad location if you are going to Knotts Berry Farm or Disneyland. Best part of this stay was the night staff was very friendly, and the weekend staff too, the day staff was very rude and if you asked them something then it was an inconvience. The website says it has a breakfast, well milk was warm, donuts gone, so if your kids will eat corn flakes dry you are ok. Room seemed ok, but bathroom had mold. We just slept here and left, price was cheap and that is what we got.

I read the reviews and was thinking this was more or less a simple hotel & a place to sleep.... Well honestly it was a place to sleep but it was horrioble.  We arrived & checked in the lady didn't really say anything to me at check in, customer service was seriously lacking, but I thought well ok. Then we went into the room, the decor is older & very simple- Thats fine, what wasn't ok was that all the windows were cracked open along the hotel- This isn't the safest part of town, you drive out of the disneyland area into a more run down part of town.,  Anyway once we walked in I realized why. The rooms were all muggy & musty smelling. They were humid to the point my hair went flat! I wasn't about to sleep with both windows unlocked so I closed them & turned on the air, the

Summary Heading: This took 2nd place to the worst experiences we have had with Motels
Summary: A big sign out front says "Weekly Rates" Which should have been our first clue to stay away. The people seemed nice but kind of oblivious to how run down and nasty this place is. The photo which shows the lobby with those awesome curtains. There is food way up high on the curtains don't ask me how it go there. The room was fairly clean and our beds were clean and I give them a 5 to a 6 for comfort. People were sitting like in lawn chairs out front of the downstairs units. We were upstairs and the tiles were cracking on the floor and falling apart. The maid forgot to clean our room one day so I called the front desk to ask for more hand towels and wash cloths and they said "Sorry, all we have is large bath towels" Are you Kidding me!! The next morning I told the manager that we

Summary Heading: Some rooms are good, some not so much.  100 TV Channels.
Summary: My first room had a bed that was so hard i could not sleep.  I was upgraded to a clean, comfortable room w/ a huge bed and plenty of room.  The satellite tv channels are great including Golf, Food, E, Bravo, etc.  The pool was closed.  Carbs and coffee for continental breakfast.  Nice people on staff at front desk.  Good housekeeping, though the third room i was moved to had disgusting carpet. Knotts Berry Farm is very close.  Shopping and restaurants nearby.

This is the most filthiest place I have ever stayed at. The hallways should have been my first clue to the lack of cleanliness at this hotel. The carpet in my room was sticky and very dirty. I had socks on and it was so dirty, I just threw them away. I was in a non-smoking room, but the blanket in my room had a cigarette burn in it. I would never stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very good service for your price
Summary: excellent services for the price.  free parking /breakfast/wifi.
Convenient location (knotts, mall). Nothing fancy here just a place to sleep. Room was decent and clean upon arrival. Would definitely recommend if you just need a place to stay.

Take one standard Days inn motor lodge from the 80's then clean and maintain sporadically to get the Days Inn Buena Park.  Worn out (scuffed furniture, door with broken lock, stained lamp sagging  balcony, a little grotty(dirty carpet, mildew and broken tiles) but cheap and close to Knotts and places to eat.

Lets be honest: what you pay is almost what you get, and mot a cent more. The room we stayed saw certainly better days, the breakfast room (doesnt exist practically) serves a breakfast you can skip.... Spidernets are welcome (spiderman would have felt at home). It doesnt mean that it is terrible, but one night is enough (especially if no option is available). The pictures you see on the net are not what i saw and i had my glasses on. But chear up, after one night theres always another day, isn't there?

Summary Heading: Suppose to stay 3 nights.  Left after first night.
Summary: We got a first floor unit on the back corner of hotel.  Furniture was worn and after walking around for less then half an hour the bottom of my white socks were brown.  No deadbolt on the door and the door frame looked like it had been reparied after someone had kicked it in.  Room suppose to have clock radio and there was none and wi fi was terrible.  Could not even use it.  There was a stain on the carpet by the bed that looked like it was from a cat coughing up a hairball.  Not enough towels in the room.   The only thing I can say positive is that check in was smooth but probably due to having booked the room on line and already paid for.  After first night went to Knott's Berry Farm Hotel which was 110% better and a very nice stay.

Summary Heading: The room stinkd like a used cat box
Summary: Do not book a room here. It's located next to a seedy side of Anaheim. Our room smelled like cat urine. Continental breakfast is donuts, coffee (which the maintenance & housekeeping take), cold cereal with milk.  Tables & chairs are set up in lobby. Not as pictured with couch. Staff hides behind highest reception desk I've ever seen. Rundown but close to Knotts Berry Farm.

Check in was relatively slow even though we were the only party there.  We appreciated that they let us checked in before 3 pm.  Our two rooms were spacious and on the second floor.  There was no elevator.  The beds were clean.  The furniture was tired however.  AC was great for the hot summer days.  There was a microwave in each room.  Good thing I brought my own towel because the towels I got for 3 out of 7 days did not pass my inspection: first day there were quite a few red stains, second day there was a few yellow stains and last day towel was so thin with black threads/stuff on it.  It is two blocks from a walgreens and within walking distance to Knotts' Berry Farm and its eating establishments.  The Buena Park mall was within walking distance maybe 20 minutes.  The staff

This hotel was a nice place to stay for a night. Clean, nice staff, has sink separate from bathroom (great for us because we were two couples staying together). Unfortunately they only gave us 3 towels for 4 people and r in need of serious updating.

We stayed 3 nights here. The front desk was friendly, the room was clean with the exception of a wet towel left on the hook of the door. The beds were comfortable they seemed pretty new. The location was good very close to Knott's and the mall. I basically got what I paid for. The hotel just seems old and needs updating.

This was our 3rd or 4th stay at this hotel since 2001. it will probably be the last. I guess it is value for money bit is getting very tired.  The place is clean enough, no problems there and the service was good. The location is excellent which is why we keep coming back. The internet was good, parking plentiful and breakfast OK.  However, the place is just tired and needs a revamp.  We did have some problems with noise coming from the 2nd floor. It amazes me how much noise people can make just walking around their room.

Summary Heading: Great rates, not such a great stay
Summary: Very close to Soak City and Knott's Berry Farm. Could actually walk there and save paying for parking if you wanted to.

Summary Heading: Okay place to stay if you are just needing to sleep
Summary: This facility is average if you need just sleep the rooms are okay... problem is this is a MOTEL your own door so forth therefore if you are traveling with kids this might make some fearful.  The carpeting is a deep dark green shag clean enough if you leave your shoes on.  Bed okay just pull back the bedspread whatever you do.... bathroom actually clean and new refreshing.  So bottom line here is if you need a cheap place to sleep book it if you are looking for anything beyond that stay away from this one.  They say they have a pool and complementary breakfast dont know we left early... there were 3 tables crammed into the tiny tiny MOTEL type of check in... I guess that is where they serve... the pool was outside size of a hottub a chair or two and by the trash containers in

We stayed here for one night during our trip to Knotts Berry Farm. I'm believe that this hotel may have had been recently renovated. Check in went well and the clerk was helpful. The carpet felt plush and was free of stains, the beds were comfortable and the room's appearance overall was warm and inviting. There was even crown molding throughout the room. The bathroom also looked newly updated. The room came with a fridge, microwave and small coffee pot. Breakfast consisted of donuts, bread, use of a toaster, two cereals that could have been Fruit Loops and Special K. There was your choice of coffee, apple or orange juice. Right across the street was Carrow's Restaurant. The location was fine with me as I knew I would be parking at Knotts although there was only a few choices of

The motel was dated, carpets were filthy, theere were ants everywhere, climbing up the wall into the ceiling. One morning the covered th sink area, disgusting! Plus we had an item stolen from our room. We were in cali to visit disney. My childrens grandma had purchased them all build a bear bears while in downtown Disney. We arrived one night with three bears, the bears never left the room again until we checked out and we checked out with only two! We asked numerous times. And even asked how honest the cleaning crew was! I am so upset that someone would steal a baby's bear!!! I will never stay at this motel or any other Days Inn motels again.

if your like me, one of those that don't see the point on wasting your $$ on expensive hotel accommodation in the states when motels will do, this is certainly a motel where we saved $$.  Ok the motel is a bit dated and so is the room, however if you are prepared to overlook a broken toilet roll holder, having to change your electronic keys a few times and the telephone didn't work,  then you can't go wrong with this motel.  The welcoming was good late at night and we were at the back of the motel upstairs but was a quiet room.   I have two requisites regardless of everything else in my stays, the first is a great shower and the second is a great bed. Besides when you on vacation what more do you want??? This is the first time i can honestly say that the bed was fantastic and it

Had 2 rooms, both top floor non smoking as requested. One room completely refurbished & the other mostly refurbished. Both had new beds & linen. Rooms were average size, neat & clean. Front office had breakfast each morning, coffee, juice, pastries & toast. We used the pool each day. Staff did their job, no more, no less. Walking distance  to Knotts, Soakcity & Carrows across the street. Value for money I would stay there again.

This is an older property, but the room was clean (other than a few stains on carpet) and in good condition.  There was a large TV and a refrigerator in the room.  Breakfast was just toast and juice and coffee, and the bread had run out at first, but when I checked back later they had restocked.  I couldn't really complain, though, because the rate for the room was very affordable.  The best thing about the room was that the beds and pillows were very comfortable.  Also, it is a very short walk to Knott's Berry Farm. It is not fancy, but I would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest, thanks for taking the time to write this review. We at the Days Inn Buena Park are committed to excellent customer service/interaction. Thank you again for your patronage and we hope to see you in the near future. Tania Torres GM Days Inn Buena Park

Summary Heading: Decent for price...semi clean....very near Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: Stayed for 1 night 2/18-2/19 for $39 AAA rate before taxes.    Stayed in room 226 second floor facing an empty parking lot.  Room was 2 Queen size bed with fridge, microwave, and 2 electric grill burners with a sink.  Decor in room was a little old and run down but decent and clean.  Carpet was kind of dirty with stain but wasn't bad.  Bathroom was clean but had a slippery tub and loud fan.    Bed:  Very Firm bedding and clean pillows, but I recommend to bring your own blankets as the provided "blanket" was uncomfortable and kinda dirty.  Bed sheets look old.  TV:  Watchable but also not too many channels.  A few channels were kind of fuzzy but otherwise ok.  Use the remote and menu settings to change the channel versions with auto programming because sometimes people will play

I stayed at the Days Inn for one night for the AAA rate of $33.30. The reviews on Trip Advisor seemed positive. The room was like a typical motel room. For the most part it was clean and the bed comfortable. Amenities include shampoo, a hair dryer and coffee. The tub knob was a little loose.  They serve a continental breakfast in the morning, but when I got there at 9AM, everything was gone. But no big deal there as they only serve sweet pastries and donuts, along with juice and coffee.  To sum it up, the Days Inn will give you a comfortable night at a low rate.

We stayed 3 nights. Plenty of pillows and towels. Bed very comfortable. Staff not very helpful but friendly. The hotel is very close to Knott's berry farm and other interesting places. Plenty of restaurants for every budget just a few blocks away. The only inconvenience was that they were working on the street and there was a detour and we got lost a couple of times.

I booked seven rooms for two days for a church youth group, so I should know how good they are.  We didn't have the same problems that other Tripadvisor members experienced.    All of the rooms were clean and in good shape. Interestingly enough, the TV in each room gets different channels.  One room got the Cartoon Network, really well, while the room next door didn't, but it got The Filipino Channel clearly.  My room got HBO, but with static, while another room didn't get HBO at all.  Strange really.    All the staff was nice and accomodating.  The lobby didn't smell of urine, but it is small, so my kids ate their breakfast in the parking lot.  Breakfast consists of toast with butter, donuts, coffee, or juice.  I concur that the pool is much too small to have a swimming party.

Room is what you would expect for $56.00 USD in Buena Park / Anaheim area.  Clean room, microwave, small fridge and king size bed.  Small pool but with only 3 or 4 chairs available it was not user friendly.    Great location and a 5 minute walk to Knotts Berry Farm and the same to Knotts Water Park.  It is located on Stanton Avenue but you can call it Beach Blvd.  Easy to find and close to everything.  Room was made up almost everymorning as we left for breakfast at 8 AM and cleaned when we returned from eating.  Hotel lobby limited, but there is coffee and doughnuts available for guests in the morning.

Summary Heading: disappointed in days inn and suites
Summary: I would not recommend this establishment for anyone. the lobby smelled of urine.  The general upkeep was poor, the whole place needed paint and carpet cleaning. My room had so many issues: a non-working T.V. being stored there, a toilet that repeatedly refused to flush  and a fist-sized hole in the wall stuffed with kleenex to name a few.  The hall way and the back parking lot were used as storage or perhaps a dumping ground for discarded furniture and mattresses. An unpleasant experience to say the least.

This was much more then I expected for the price. The room was clean and it was close to Knott's Berry Farm (Big plus). The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Usually you get what you pay for, but in this case we feel like we got a great deal. We were just loking for a place to sleep for the night, and this was much nicer then other hotels we have come accross.

We pre booked this hotel thru an agency - what a bad move - we arrived at this run down shack of a days inn - the room smelt damp and the carpets were filthy. we only had one night to spend here thankfully - my husband did not sleep all night for fear of the door being kicked in - it looked as though it had been done before. it appeared that there were families living in the motel permanently they may have been on welfare. continental breakfast which we did not stay for consisted of coffee and donuts in reception. overall a nasty motel much better available in anaheim for the same and cheaper rates.
